result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony T. Shannon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 9:46am. 
Defendant Anthony T. Shannon in court, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #3 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts pleas, finds Mr. Shannon guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Counts #1 & #2.

The Defendant rejects Probation. 

On Count #3, the Court sentences Mr. Shannon  to:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for employment and for alcohol and drug treatment ; to commence forthwith
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge
--to comply with DNA sample provision 


On Count #4, the Court sentences Mr. Shannon  to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for employment and for alcohol and drug treatment, consecutive to the Jail term in Count #3
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge
--to comply with DNA sample provision 



Days credit for time already served given:  6 days 
Mr. Shannon is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served, with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
The court ordered financial obligations are to be paid in $75 per month installments commencing on 8/31/16 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 18 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

Case called at 1:25pm [mo]
Defendant Anthony T. Shannon appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

The Court reviews court record.

Bond arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $500 CASH  bond, with conditions as previously set. 
Atty. Svehlek inquires if victim rights will be complied with for a proposed plea/sentencing tomorrow. 

recess 1:31 pm. 


NEXT: Plea/Sentencing on 6/9/16 at 9:30am
Defendant in custody // Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD

Case called at 9:23 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for Final Status Scheduling Conference)
Attorney Whitney Hagemann in court. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anthony T. Shannon not in court. 
Atty Hagemann informs the Court that she has no explanation for her client's non-appearance today
Court reviews case file documents and notes that notice was mailed to last known address, which was not returned as undeliverable. Today's date was given orally at last Court date and Mr. Shannon also received hand written notice from Clerk following last hearing.
ADA Beck requests warrant
Court orders issuance of bench warrant-Body Only - Court requests intake Court set CASH bond as jury trial had to be canceled in this matter
Court cancels trial and allows release of witnesses
Recess: 9:26 am
Jury trial on June 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Notice

Case called at 2:19 pm [sf]
Defendant Anthony T. Shannon in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney De La Rosa advises that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Address and DOB information verified by the Court.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Christine Shannon

Attorney De La Rosa requests that he be given 24 hours to file a substitution.
Court will allow the defense 24 hours to file a substituion request, and will set Status in Branch 4.

Recess: 2:22 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 1/20/16 at 9:00 am
Status: 2/5/16 at 1:30 pm (Branch 4)
